title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 11
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: We saw nothing of them this morningon the Whins; he's passed us by, he doesna seem to be looking, and yethere he is on our road! Dod, Davie, I begin to take a notion.

title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 11
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Steering by this, but a good deal at random, and with some trampling ofthe harvest, and stumbling and falling down upon the bauks, we made ourway across country, and won forth at last upon the linky, boggy muirlandthat they call the Figgate Whins.

title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 11
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Thereshould be left in our native city some seed of the elect; somelong-legged, hot-headed youth must repeat to-day our dreams andwanderings of so many years ago; he will relish the pleasure, whichshould have been ours, to follow among named streets and numbered housesthe country walks of David Balfour, to identify Dean, and Silvermills,and Broughton, and Hope Park, and Pilrig, and poor old Lochend--if itstill be standing, and the Figgate Whins--if there be any of them left;or to push (on a long holiday) so far afield as Gillane or the Bass.
